cleaned_text: KB Campral for use to decrease alcohol cravings, including when to take it, how long it works, side effects and what happens when someone on Campral drin [](/wps/wcm/connect/public+content/sa+health+internet/resources/acamprosate+campral+patient+client+information) If a patient is alcohol dependent and they want to reduce or stop drinking, the use of medications as part of an overall treatment strategy enhances the likelihood of success. The [Pharmacotherapies indicated for alcohol dependence (PDF 17KB)](/wps/wcm/connect/public+content/sa+health+internet/resources/pharmacotherapies+indicated+for+alcohol+dependence) factsheet describes what each of these medications does, when to start treatment, the term of the treatment, side effects, contraindications and precautions. For information about the effectiveness of different medications in relapse prevention, see [DASSA Monograph No. 26: Pharmacotherapies for relapse prevention in alcohol dependence (PDF 4830KB)](/wps/wcm/connect/public+content/sa+health+internet/resources/dassa+monograph+no+26+-+2011) Clients can be referred to the [Medication-assisted treatment for alcohol dependence](/wps/wcm/connect/public+content/sa+health+internet/conditions/alcohol/medication+assisted+treatment+for+alcohol+dependence) page for more information about drug treatment and how it works, [Alcohol and Drug Information Service (ADIS)](/wps/wcm/connect/public+content/sa+health+internet/services/mental+health+and+drug+and+alcohol+services/drug+and+alcohol+services/dassa+services/alcohol+and+drug+information+service+adis) or call [1300 13 1340](tel:1300131340) [Drug and Alcohol Clinical Advisory Service (DACAS)](/wps/wcm/connect/public+content/sa+health+internet/clinical+resources/clinical+programs+and+practice+guidelines/substance+misuse+and+dependence/drug+and+alcohol+clinical+advisory+service+dacas). DACAS provides a telephone and email service for South Australian health professionals seeking clinical information and clarification around clinical procedures, guidelines and evidence-based practice.
